title: When is Merello going to get to poppy
body:
First macnoon ran poppy. Now UoL are running poppy. 

Its time merello filled his promise if poppy ever got viable she would be hit on the head again with the nerf bat. 

Sadly the fact that poppy is viable again proves that we have be in negative power creep for 3 seasons. Champs like poppy and ireilla who were consistently gutted to not be viable cause of their problematic game play. Now after 3 seasons of nerfs the problematic champs are considered good again. 

When merello or any game play designer talks about power creep remember how many times ireilla was nerfed and how she is good again.

Leave Poppy Alone. No more olafings need to happen.

The fact that morello would even say that he would nerf a champ as soon as they became viable is idiotic. Her rework is coming soon anyways, and no one plays her. Leave her alone. She is just as good as she was before patch 4.20, and us Poppy mains can attest to that.

No one plays her.... WHAT!!!!!!!! 

You are not following the pro scene.

She has seen no where near as much play as other champions (Lee Sin, Lucian, etc)
 
Plus, the team that is currently using her successfully has also pulled off various other non meta picks.If anything, they are telling the meta to go **** itself, and i love it. Nerf a champ because she isnt part of the Meta? Really?

If Poppy gets nerfed, while Lee Sin, Orianna, and various others do get touched at all, then Riot has proved itself to be incapable. There are much bigger fish to fry besides Poppy and Irelia.
the problem is not how much. The fact that she viable is the issue. The kit is pretty broken and merello stated her being viable is a issue for game health. Which is why she should be nerfed again.

Again, there are much worse offenders of champions being unhealthy. Orianna, a utility mage whom does god tier amounts of damage is a prime example.

If Poppy is gonna be taken down, than alot of other champs need to go with her.

> Again, there are much worse offenders of champions being unhealthy. Orianna, a utility mage whom does god tier amounts of damage is a prime example.

Healthy doesn't mean balanced.  It means balanceable.  Numbers on kits have nothing to do with champion health.  Orianna might be overtuned, but she's a super healthy champion.

Poppy's current kit is not healthy.  She cannot exist in a balanced state.  If she becomes good enough to play, she breaks teamfight mechanics.
Yes, Orianna was a bad example.

You did not read the post. MORELLO SAID IF POPPY was VIABLE. This has nothing to do with being OP. But a kit that is unhealthy for the game. 

Thx for not reading or comprehending

I don't know why it is so hard for you to understand this very simple concept.

Why must champion A be gutted for reason A, when champion B is a much bigger offender of reason A, and is also an offender of reasons B and C.

you are bronze 1 trash and do not understand that the kit of poppy was determined by riot is SEASON 1/2 that poppys kit is not a healthy kit. She does not promote healthy game play and was nerfed to near complete unviability. There is nothing healthy about her current kit as is.

I haven't seen that game yet, but the announcer made it sound like the last time this guy played Poppy, it did not go well.  Could be a different guy, for all I know; I don't follow the pro scene.

Right now, it seems she's being picked under very narrow criteria and is not showing up and is not dominating, so I don't think he's going to suddenly Eve-bat her.  If he does, he's not getting any cupcakes for christmas ~_~

EDIT:  Watched the last few minutes of the game.  In teamfights, they did much better...totally shut Poppy down.  Don't think I saw a banshee's, but I'm pretty confident in saying her ult isn't bad enough to qualify her as a broken champ.

Non-viable champs can do well now and again.

Also, I just watched the game, and it was kind of gross how poorly they handled her.  First, she was constantly farming without any repercussions.  She's not a quick farmer either...you can really punish her team if she's off in another lane.  Second, they were constantly wall-hugging.  That time when they approached her split push, Maokai was sliding along his turret wall and got slammed, then Orianna stood still in the same place Mao got slammed at for like three seconds, allowing a second stun.

I don't think she's as good as she looked there...

Just my thoughts on the matter, haven't done any math or tried it out to see, but I feel like poppy will have some nerfs coming in soon enough.

Yes, but that's what Poppy does, she terrorizes carries.  Visichachi build her to be very fragile (pure damage/chasing) so she was pretty weak when her ult was down.

:o

I've always wanted to be bronze 1 trash; they seem to have so much more fun.

Her ult doesn't 'weakness' her target, w/e that means.  It does increase her damage versus them, which is maybe what you were trying to say.

At any rate, while Poppy was once problematic, we're now in an era of champions that are considered trash-tier unless they're problematic.  Her ult has gameplay issues, but her overall kit is still very sub-par in terms of actually getting things done.  The fact that she has to hit people into walls to access a large chunk of her damage early-mid game and all of her cc means she starts off well below your standard fighter.  In addition, she needs some damage to function well, so she tends to blow up without her ult even with her passive.  Then there's the lack of sustain, low early mana/mregen and rather unreliable charge terrain detection...

She really doesn't need the Eve treatmeant.  She's playable, just not competitive.
